item.title: Mairi add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Little girls are cute and small only to adults. To one another they are not cute. They are life sized." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Mairi add a quote by Arturo Perez-Reverte
item.description: "I once wrestled with an angel. He won, but I learned a few things." -- Arturo Perez-Reverte

item.title: Mairi add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "It is never too late to be what you might have been." -- George Eliot

item.title: Mairi add a quote by Caitlin R. Kiernan
item.description: "I need a world filled with wonder, with awe, with awful things. I couldn't exist in a world devoid of marvels, even if the marvels are terrible marvels. Even if they frighten me to consider them." -- Caitlin R. Kiernan

item.title: Mairi add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic." -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: Mairi add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "Once a little boy sent me a charming card with a little drawing on it. I loved it. I answer all my children’s letters — sometimes very hastily — but this one I lingered over. I sent him a card and I drew a picture of a Wild Thing on it. I wrote, “Dear Jim: I loved your card.” Then I got a letter back from his mother and she said, “Jim loved your card so much he ate it.” That to me was one of the highest compliments I’ve ever received. He didn’t care that it was an original Maurice Sendak drawing or anything. He saw it, he loved it, he ate it." -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Mairi add a quote by Katherine Dunn
item.description: "A carnival in daylight is an unfinished beast, anyway. Rain makes it a ghost. The wheezing music from the empty, motionless rides in a soggy, rained-out afternoon midway always hit my chest with a sweet ache. The colored dance of the lights in the seeping air flashed the puddles in the sawdust with an oily glamour." -- Katherine Dunn

item.title: Mairi add a quote by Carol Rifka Brunt
item.description: "I knew the way lost hopes could be dangerous, how they could turn a person into someone they never thought they'd be." -- Carol Rifka Brunt

item.title: Mairi add a quote by Rafael Sabatini
item.description: "He was born with a gift of laughter and a sense that the world was mad. And that was all his patrimony." -- Rafael Sabatini

item.title: Mairi add a quote by John Green
item.description: "As he read, I fell in love the way you fall asleep: slowly, and then all at once." -- John Green

item.title: Mairi add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "Promise me you'll always remember: You're braver than you believe, and stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Mairi add a quote by Craig Clevenger
item.description: "It's taken me years of practice to learn how to act natural." -- Craig Clevenger

item.title: Mairi add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "The passage of time will usually extract the venom of most things and render them harmless" -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Mairi add a quote by Jenny Lawson
item.description: "Because you are defined not by life's imperfect moments, but by your reaction to them. And because there is joy in embracing - rather than running from - the utter absurdity of life." -- Jenny Lawson

item.title: Mairi add a quote by Helen Oyeyemi
item.description: "Solitary people, these book lovers. I think it's swell that there are people you don't have to worry about when you don't see them for a long time, you don't have to wonder what they do, how they're getting along with themselves. You just know that they're all right, and probably doing something they like." -- Helen Oyeyemi

item.title: Mairi add a quote by Patrick McCabe
item.description: "All the beautiful things in this world are lies. They count for nothing in the end." -- Patrick McCabe
